page.title: 03A MODERN VILLAGE PUB
page.content: The Bull's Head is a pub on the edge of Mottram St. Andrew village. It is surrounded by a huge car park, which is full of cars nearly every night. People come from as far as Wilmslow, Bramhall and Macclesfield to have a meal because it is not only a pub it is a resaurant as well. The restaurant is the most important part of the Bull's Head. Recently changes took place, Beefeater took over. Beefeater is a chain of Steak Houses owned by Whitbread. Beefeater extended the pub to make room for a Steak House. They carried out many internal alterations. The Bull's Head is not the only place where you can get a drink in Mottram. There is a bar at the Village Hall which is open on Sunday and Tuesday. by Laura Sidebotham and Shelley Anderson.
